qas.question: What title regarding London has never been made official in law or by decree?

answers.text: London's status as the capital of England

qas.question: What areas within Greater London have city status?

answers.text: the City of London and the City of Westminster

qas.question: For what reason are the City of London and Greater London considered to be counties?

context: Within London, both <a1_0>the City of London and the City of Westminster<a1_0/> have city status and both the City of London and the remainder of Greater London are counties <a2_0>for the purposes of lieutenancies<a2_0/>. The area of Greater London has incorporated areas that were once part of the historic counties of Middlesex, Kent, Surrey, Essex and Hertfordshire. <a0_0>London's status as the capital of England<a0_0/>, and later the United Kingdom, has never been granted or confirmed officially—by statute or in written form.[note 6]
